name: Stable Diffusion

score_rationale.persistence: Released August 2022. Multiple versions (1.4, XL, 3.5). Stability AI turbulence but model continues. ~3.5 years active.
score_rationale.autonomy: Generates images from prompts. No autonomous agency—requires human direction for each generation.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: Democratized AI image generation. First major open-source alternative to DALL-E. Runs on consumer GPUs. AUTOMATIC1111, ComfyUI ecosystem. Foundation for thousands of fine-tuned models.
score_rationale.economic_reality: Stability AI raised significant funding. Open-source model enables commercial use. Ecosystem of services built on it. Company had financial difficulties in 2024.
score_rationale.governance: Open-source with permissive license (CreativeML Open RAIL-M). Community forks and modifications. Stability AI corporate decisions for base model.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: Latent diffusion architecture. 860M parameter U-Net, relatively lightweight. Runs on consumer hardware. Open weights enable customization and fine-tuning.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: 'Autonomous freedom to produce stunning art.' Open-source democratization message. Stability AI corporate challenges complicate narrative.

curator_notes: Stable Diffusion's August 2022 open-source release was a watershed moment for AI art—the first time a state-of-the-art image generator could run on consumer hardware. Developed by Stability AI, Runway, and academic collaborators using the LAION-5B dataset, SD's latent diffusion architecture is relatively lightweight (860M parameters) yet produces photorealistic images. The open-source release spawned an ecosystem: AUTOMATIC1111 WebUI, ComfyUI, thousands of fine-tuned models (LoRAs), and professional tools. While Stability AI faced corporate difficulties in 2024, Stable Diffusion itself became infrastructure—the Linux of AI image generation.

evidence.claim: First major open-source alternative to DALL-E, runs on consumer GPUs
